event.title: was administered by the Portuguese Empire and its inheritor states from the mid-16th century until late 1999

data.event: As Portuguese Macau, it was administered by the Portuguese Empire and its inheritor states from the mid-16th century until late 1999, when it was the last remaining European colony in Asia under Portugal.
In 1557, Macau was rented to Portugal from Ming China as a trading port.

event.title: administered the city under Chinese authority and sovereignty until 1887

data.event: The Portuguese Empire administered the city under Chinese authority and sovereignty until 1887, when Macau became a colony.

event.title: was transferred to China on 20 December 1999

data.event: Sovereignty over Macau was transferred to China on 20 December 1999.

event.title: operate with a high degree of autonomy until at least 2049

data.event: The Joint Declaration on the Question of Macau and Macau Basic Law stipulate that Macau operate with a high degree of autonomy until at least 2049, fifty years after the transfer.
